intro: Hieracium maculatum subsp. divisum, commonly known as the spotted hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in white or yellowish hairs. The plant produces yellow flowers in clusters, which bloom from June to August. Its leaves and stems are often dotted with small, white or pale spots, giving it its common name. It is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed soils, and is considered an invasive species in some regions.
